intro: Tonsella paniculata, commonly known as the panicled tonsella, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in paniculate inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Tonsella paniculata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
